intro: Hieracium madagascariense, commonly known as the Madagascar hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy areas and has basal leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
